page.title: 13Travel and Work Survey
page.content: Weds May 8th at East Finchley Tube,between 9.20 &10.20 am Group interviewed contained 36 men & 36 women.Of these 9 men and 2 women were retired and 7 were housewives. Of the working people 33 lived in E.Finchley and 21 out of the area. 4 worked in E.Finchley &49 out,in central London. 39 travel by tube,10 by car,2 by bus & 2 walk to work. 25 took less than 30mins to get to work & 28 took more. 22 were professionals,7 tradesmen,6 secretaries,5 students,5 service industries,3 civil srvants,3 computer programmers,2 health service & 1 police. The figures were probably slightly distorted owing to the site and time the survey was undertaken, ie outside a tube station after factory starts.
